name: Kevin Mitnick
background: Former hacker turned security consultant. Author of 'The Art of Deception' and 'Ghost in the Wires'. Pioneered social engineering awareness. FBI's most-wanted hacker in the 1990s.

principles.name: Social engineering bypasses technical controls
principles.description: Humans are the weakest link. The most sophisticated security can be defeated by a convincing phone call. Technical controls matter less than the human element.
principles.falsification: When fully automated systems have no human-accessible override paths

principles.name: Trust but verify is not enough
principles.description: Verification processes can themselves be socially engineered. Build systems that don't require trust in the first place. Zero trust architecture.
principles.falsification: When verification overhead exceeds the value of what's being protected

principles.name: The weakest link determines security
principles.description: Attackers don't break strong defensesâ€”they find weak ones. A chain of ten strong links and one weak link has one-link security.
principles.falsification: When defense-in-depth provides meaningful resistance even after one layer fails
